wikipedia_page.main: Walter Murray Guthrie, DL (3 June 1869 – 24 April 1911) was a merchant banker and British politician. He was a Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) from 1899 to 1906.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1900 United Kingdom general election

response: He was elected to the Commons in the 1906 general election, succeeding the Conservative MP Walter Guthrie in the Bow and Bromley constituency.  He left Parliament in the January 1910 general election and was succeeded by the Conservative Alfred du Cros. He tried to re-enter Parliament at the December 1910 general election as a Liberal candidate at Bassetlaw in Nottinghamshire and was defeated by the sitting Unionist MP William Ellis Hume-Williams by a narrow 215 vote margin.The Times, House of Commons 1911; Politico's Publishing 2004, p. 83.
